speaker: EARL OF SALISBURY
text_entry: ACT III

speaker: EARL OF SALISBURY
text_entry: SCENE I. Bristol. Before the castle.

speaker: EARL OF SALISBURY
text_entry: Enter HENRY BOLINGBROKE, DUKE OF YORK,  NORTHUMBERLAND, LORD ROSS, HENRY PERCY, LORD WILLOUGHBY, with BUSHY and GREEN, prisoners

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Bring forth these men.

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Bushy and Green, I will not vex your souls--

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Since presently your souls must part your bodies--

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: With too much urging your pernicious lives,

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: For 'twere no charity; yet, to wash your blood

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: From off my hands, here in the view of men

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: I will unfold some causes of your deaths.

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: You have misled a prince, a royal king,

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: A happy gentleman in blood and lineaments,

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: By you unhappied and disfigured clean:

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: You have in manner with your sinful hours

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Made a divorce betwixt his queen and him,

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Broke the possession of a royal bed

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: And stain'd the beauty of a fair queen's cheeks

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: With tears drawn from her eyes by your foul wrongs.

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Myself, a prince by fortune of my birth,

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Near to the king in blood, and near in love

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Till you did make him misinterpret me,

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Have stoop'd my neck under your injuries,

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: And sigh'd my English breath in foreign clouds,

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Eating the bitter bread of banishment;

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Whilst you have fed upon my signories,

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Dispark'd my parks and fell'd my forest woods,

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: From my own windows torn my household coat,

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Razed out my imprese, leaving me no sign,

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Save men's opinions and my living blood,

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: To show the world I am a gentleman.

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: This and much more, much more than twice all this,

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Condemns you to the death. See them deliver'd over

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: To execution and the hand of death.

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: More welcome is the stroke of death to me

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: Than Bolingbroke to England. Lords, farewell.

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: My comfort is that heaven will take our souls

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: And plague injustice with the pains of hell.

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: My Lord Northumberland, see them dispatch'd.

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Exeunt NORTHUMBERLAND and others, with the prisoners

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Uncle, you say the queen is at your house;

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: For God's sake, fairly let her be entreated:

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Tell her I send to her my kind commends;

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Take special care my greetings be deliver'd.

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: A gentleman of mine I have dispatch'd

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: With letters of your love to her at large.

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Thank, gentle uncle. Come, lords, away.

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: To fight with Glendower and his complices:

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Awhile to work, and after holiday.

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Exeunt
